android.car.input

类 RotaryEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.car.input.RotaryEvent

  • public final class RotaryEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    Parcelable containing rotary input event.

    A rotary input event can be either clockwise or counterclockwise and can contain more than 1 click. Each click has its own event time.

    • 字段详细资料

        public static final <any> CREATOR

    • 构造器详细资料

      • RotaryEvent

        public RotaryEvent(int inputType,
                   boolean clockwise,
                   long[] uptimeMillisForClicks)
        Creates a new RotaryEvent.
        参数:
        inputType - Represents the type of rotary event. This indicates which knob was rotated. For example, it can be CarInputManager.INPUT_TYPE_ROTARY_NAVIGATION.
        clockwise - Indicates if the event is clockwise (=true) or counterclockwise (=false).
        uptimeMillisForClicks - Stores the event times of all clicks. Time used is uptime in milliseconds. See android.os.SystemClock#uptimeMillis() for the definition of the time.

        Timestamps are guaranteed to be monotonically increasing. If the input device cannot capture timestamps for each click, all the timestamps will be the same.

    • 方法详细资料

      • getNumberOfClicks

        public int getNumberOfClicks()
        Returns the number of clicks contained in this event.

      • getUptimeMillisForClick

        public long getUptimeMillisForClick(int clickIndex)
        Returns the event time for the requested clickIndex. The time is recorded as android.os.SystemClock#uptimeMillis().
        参数:
        clickIndex - Index of click to check the time. It should be in the range of 0 to getNumberOfClicks() - 1.
        返回:
        Event time

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        覆盖:
        toString 在类中 java.lang.Object

      • getInputType

        public int getInputType()
        Represents the type of rotary event. This indicates which knob was rotated. For example, it can be CarInputManager.INPUT_TYPE_ROTARY_NAVIGATION.

      • isClockwise

        public boolean isClockwise()
        Indicates if the event is clockwise (=true) or counterclockwise (=false).

      • getUptimeMillisForClicks

        public long[] getUptimeMillisForClicks()
        Stores the event times of all clicks. Time used is uptime in milliseconds. See android.os.SystemClock#uptimeMillis() for the definition of the time.

        Timestamps are guaranteed to be monotonically increasing. If the input device cannot capture timestamps for each click, all the timestamps will be the same.
